entry.title: SHADESCENE Releases Tawau Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. SHADESCENE has recently released their rendition of Tawau Airport (WBKW) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. The airport serves the Tawau Division in Malaysia and has a yearly average of 572,365 passengers. The airport was inaugurated in December 2001, replacing Tawauâs former main airport. It was small and tricky due to its very short runway (one of the shortest in Malaysia), which caused great concern overall.Â The official inauguration only happened two years later, in 2003.Â Its passenger terminal has one and a half stories, with two jetways and the ability to accommodate up to 8 airplanes simultaneously. â Before COVID-19, the airport was operating above maximum capacity, reaching 1.8 million passengers yearly, significantly exceeding its intended 1.4 million passenger capacity. A plan was made to expand it to 2.5 million passengers and upgrade the passenger facilities and overall infrastructure. COVID put a halt to the expansion plans, and in 2022, they were still facing the same issue, constantly suffering from congestion. â In 2023, the government allocated a substantial sum for an improvement program, including extra toilets, an enhanced check-in area, an expanded departure lounge, more retail spaces, and more air conditioning units. A year later, a new plan was announced, encompassing a major expansion set to begin in 2025. The expansion will bring the main terminal from 15,800 square meters to 23,500, add eight new check-in counters, and more. The new capacity would remain aligned with the previous project at 2.5 million passengers annually. â AirAsia, Batik Air Malaysia, Firefly, Malaysia Airlines, and MASwings serve it. â The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with custom terraforming, custom scenery objects, custom ground textures, custom night lighting, and more. â Itâs available on SimMarket for roughly $14.02, requiring at least 345.46 MB of free hard disk space to install. entry.title: iFly Outlines Future Plans, Confirms MSFS 2024 Focus and MAX 9
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. iFly has via Discord released an official development update for its 737 MAX product, outlining planned features for the Service Pack 1 update, as well as its plans for the MSFS 2024 platform. The team made it clear that the SP1 content is still in active development, and that the update will not be released within the next three months. Amongst the changes in SP1 are a more âtablet-styleâ electronic flight bag (EFB), rather than the current Boeing OEM unit, accompanied by CPDLC integration via the Hoppie API, with support for online networks, as well as BATC and SayIntentions, also under review. Other planned features include cabin announcements (with and without GSX), the MAX 8-200 variant, with the typeâs Mid-Cabin Emergency Doors modelled, a visual APU model, an expanded main wheel well model, and an updated fuselage model, rivets and other details. Cabin materials will be redrawn with more texture detail, multiple seating layouts will be offered, and cockpit materials will be refined for better surface type distinction. Landing gear textures will be overhauled, LNAV behaviour will see targeted adjustments, and numerous smaller fixes will be implemented before release. The update also marks a shift in development priorities. SP1 will be the final major release to support MSFS 2020, with all future development moving to MSFS 2024, due to substantial platform differences between the two. Post-SP1 plans include a native MSFS 2024 version of the MAX 9, with the MAX 10 and MAX 7 also under consideration, only after official certification and service entry of those types. While small patches may still arrive for the current MAX 8 for 2020 after SP1, iFlyâs primary focus will be advancing the series for the newer simulator. The light twin-engine aircraft arrives as the latest addition to the developerâs growing MSFS 2024 catalogue. The Baron B55 is a light twin, first introduced in 1961, as part of Beechcraftâs Baron family, which evolved from the earlier Travel Air. Production of the 55 series continued until 1983, with 3,651 units built. Powered by two Continental IO-470-L engines, producing 260 horsepower each, the aircraft is capable of cruising at around 190 knots, with a range of more than 900 nautical miles. entry.title: Miltech & Blackbird Update MH-60 for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Miltech and Blackbird Simulations have recently released version 1.0.2 of their MH-60 Multi-Mission Helicopter add-on for MSFS 2020 and 2024, bringing a series of improvements, optimisations, and fixes. The new version introduces a further reworked flight model, aiming to improve overall manoeuvrability, hover control, and responsiveness across pitch, roll, and yaw inputs. Rotor animations and blade coning have also been refined. Optimised textures and further compression have improved VRAM usage by about 1 gigabyte, and mipmapping has been added for further scalability across different hardware. Autopilot and hover mode control logic have been revised for improved stability, alongside more accurate vertical speed control. Version 1.0.2 also includes new keybinds for hover adjustments, as well as clickable rotor brake and search light controls. Visual enhancements such as dynamic dirt, mud, and insect accumulation were also added. According to the changelog, the release resolves more than 40 issues, ranging from livery errors and animation bugs to lighting, radio, and crew call. Specific fixes include adjustments to the APU, tail fold, and pitot cover textures. Several regressions in textures were also addressed. Miltech noted that users who previously installed the low-VRAM patch of the MH-60 should first test the new version 1.0.2 without it, as memory optimisation has been significantly improved in this update. A patch will still be available for those requiring additional performance adjustments. The developers also confirmed ongoing work on Mission Hub, with further improvements, bug fixes, and new features expected soon. Testing is also underway for an Xbox release of both the MH-60 and Mission Hub, with version 1.0.2 set as the release build. entry.title: Microsoft Releases Sim Update 3 for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Microsoft has recently released the highly anticipated Sim Update 3 for MSFS 2024, marking one of the biggest updates to the simulator since launch. It brings performance fixes, weather and world upgrades, aircraft, traffic, and ATC changes, airport improvements, SDK updates, and broad adjustments to core systems, and career mode. Labelled version 1.5.27.0, SU3 brings wide-ranging changes, including the highly requested ability to locally download content from the MSFS Library. This allows more control over content management, with simulator files being able to be stored locally on a userâs system, rather than relying solely on cloud-based streaming and internet downloads. Fixes to weather include an issue where the correct METAR data was not always honoured at airports; furthermore, lightning in storms is now far less excessive, thunderstorm prediction is better, and cloud transitions on the world map are smoother. Distant cloud lighting has been improved, photogrammetry tile popping is reduced, and map camera zooming has been corrected. Streaming reliability should be better, including fixes for freezes caused by mislabelled sound folders. AI and live traffic now flow more smoothly, with fewer overshoots, ârear-end incidentsâ, and stuck vehicles. Taxi speeds have been tuned, parked aircraft distribution rebalanced, and model-matching now prefers AI-optimised assets. Contrails rendering has been improved, gear animations have been corrected, livery depiction improved, and generic placeholder aircraft have been phased out. Aircraft across the default fleet have received updates, with refinements to Garmin avionics and autopilot systems. The Boeing 787, 747, and Airbus A320neo have seen flight dynamics and stability tweaks, while the Cessna 172 and Daher TBM 930 have received various bug fixes and performance improvements. Significant performance and stability upgrades have also been introduced. Sim Update 3 includes better memory management, improved CPU and GPU balancing, and reduced stuttering, during heavy scenery loading. Smoother framerates should be noticable in high-density areas, such as large international airports, and photogrammetry-heavy cities.Â Some of the addressed issues include Xbox boot crashes when many packages are installed, several rare parser and stallâwarning crashes, VR in/out switching, airportârendering freezes, and texture handling that could corrupt WASM gauges, on Series S, or lowâtexture settings on PC. Menu caching in Controls now reduces unnecessary file I/O, and avatar thumbnails are generated faster. DLSS MultiâFrame Generation options have been corrected, and multiple content management edge cases have been cleaned up, in order to prevent profile or content conflicts. Sim Update 3 is available now on all platforms, as a free download for all MSFS 2024 users. Full patch notes can be found on the official Microsoft Flight Simulator website, and the MSFS forums. Be aware, Microsoft is currently investigating an issue with SU3 deployment, on Xbox and Microsoft Store. This may cause issues with downloading the update, for certain machines.
